abstract: A favored online tactic to mock the president — altering the Google search engine so the words “miserable failure” lead to President Bush’s home page — has been neutralized.
snippet: A favored online tactic to mock the president — altering the Google search engine so the words “miserable failure” lead to President Bush’s home page — has been neutralized.
lead_paragraph: It has been a bad month for anti-Bush snarkiness.

headline.main: Google Halts ‘Miserable Failure’ Link to President Bush
headline.print_headline: Google Halts ‘Miserable Failure’ Link to President Bush

abstract: President Bush set broad goals last week for the adoption of alternative energy. Hoping to take on the role of filling in the details is an unlikely group: Silicon Valley’s technology investors. These venture capitalists, backers of giants like Google and Genentech, have traditionally been free-market advocates, favoring ideas and innovation over government intervention. Now they are heading to Washington on a crusade to influence energy policy because they have a big stake in the outcome.
lead_paragraph: President Bush set broad goals last week for the adoption of alternative energy. headline.main: Tech Barons Take on Energy Policy
